page.title: 03Kielder Salmon Hatchery
page.content: When Kielder Water was formed,and the valley was flooded, many of the salmons' spawning grounds were lost. {Northumbrian Water}decided to make amends for this by establishing a {salmon hatchery.}It was set up on the ourskirts of Kielder Village, on the banks of the Kielder Burn. The Hatchery has been very successful in its aim to rear salmon from eggs, and has released more than 1 million{ salmon{parr}into the River Tyne and its tributaries. About 20% of these make the journey to feeding grounds off{Greenland},and about 15% manage to return to the{ {Tyne.}This could mean some 15,000 large fish making "home runs". It is possible to book visits to the Hatchery ({Wednesdays}) through the Tower Knowe Kielder Water Information Centre.
